citations.narrative:
The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care for vaccinations. None of the 22 adult dogs are up to date on the
required rabies vaccination. The last rabies vaccine was given to all adult dogs on February 24, 2022. The current
Program of Vet Care prescribes for the vaccination to be performed yearly in adult dogs (with the exception of pregnant
females), therefore, the dogs are seven months overdue.
- Adult male (M) Corgi “CJ Flash” (#2138). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Janey” (#9503). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Linda” (#2899). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Corgi “Pansy” (#4275). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Twila”. The rabies vaccine is due. –
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Lisa” (#0679). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Julie” (#4347). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult male (M) Corgi “CR Eddie” (#9776). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Cavalier “CR Cindy” (#4288). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Cavalier “CR Kari” (#7902). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Cavalier “CR Lexi II”. The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Cavalier “CR Debra”. The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult male (M) Cavalier “CR Rubio”. The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult male (M) Dachshund “CR Remi” (#4919). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Dachshund “CR Nettie” (#5710). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Dachshund “CR Misty” (#2668). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Dachshund “CR Lila” (#5254). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Dachshund “CR May” (#5341). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult male (M) Pug “CR Elam” (#5465). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Pug “CR Wanda” (#5509). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Pug “CR Polly” (#5828). The rabies vaccine is due.
- Adult female (F) Pug “CR Lori”. The rabies vaccine is due.
Rabies is a life-threatening disease to dogs and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering. It is also important
for breeding females to be vaccinated as they will pass immunity to their offspring through their milk. Correct by
vaccinating against diseases listed in the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies) in accordance
with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and vaccine manufacturer recommendations. Correct by:
November 9, 2023.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by December 25, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care for vaccinations. None of the 22 adult dogs are up to date on the 
required rabies vaccination. The last rabies vaccine was given to all adult dogs on February 24, 2022. The current 
Program of Vet Care prescribes for the vaccination to be performed yearly in adult dogs (with the exception of pregnant 
females), therefore, the dogs are seven months overdue. 
 
- Adult male (M) Corgi “CJ Flash” (#2138). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Janey” (#9503). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Linda” (#2899). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Corgi “Pansy” (#4275). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Twila”. The rabies vaccine is due. – 
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Lisa” (#0679). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Corgi “CR Julie” (#4347). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult male (M) Corgi “CR Eddie” (#9776). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Cavalier “CR Cindy” (#4288). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Cavalier “CR Kari” (#7902). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Cavalier “CR Lexi II”. The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Cavalier “CR Debra”. The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult male (M) Cavalier “CR Rubio”. The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult male (M) Dachshund “CR Remi” (#4919). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Dachshund “CR Nettie” (#5710). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Dachshund “CR Misty” (#2668). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Dachshund “CR Lila” (#5254). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Dachshund “CR May” (#5341). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult male (M) Pug “CR Elam” (#5465). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Pug “CR Wanda” (#5509). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Pug “CR Polly” (#5828). The rabies vaccine is due.  
- Adult female (F) Pug “CR Lori”. The rabies vaccine is due.  
 
Rabies is a life-threatening disease to dogs and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering. It is also important

for breeding females to be vaccinated as they will pass immunity to their offspring through their milk. Correct by 
vaccinating against diseases listed in the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies) in accordance 
with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and vaccine manufacturer recommendations. Correct by: 
November 9, 2023. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by December 25, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
